channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole on left lane, 26th January
item.description:
On the left lane heading towards Kingsditch area, there is a pot hole in the road. The spot on the map pinned is not exact but it is somewhere in front of the large block of flats.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Princess Elizabeth Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole preventing access to private road. Parton Court Farm lane access is private road, however entrance and triangle bit of land (which contains bus stop and footpath) and exit from lane, which goes into Parish Council offices and play park are owned by, and should be maintained by Council. Thanks., 26th January
item.description:
As above. Exit and entrance to private road have large potholes causing access issues for residents.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a tennis ball in the hole for clarity, 26th January
item.description:
I am six of these potholes outside my property. Again, I stood in it, in the dark while it was filled with water. Another twisted ankle, one of these days I will break it! The loose chippings that I have to keep sweeping away, are being shot of the road by passing cars, all over my drive. It gets everywhere, even in my dogs paws. Soon as one hole is fixed, another appears. I just hope I don’t actually get a break from these holes, or someone falls of their bike due to this, as it’s all along the designated cycle lane on Shelley Road. The whole stretch needs redoing, this little patches are useless .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Shelley Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
